channel.title: Comments on: Hong Kong Trip: Part 3 – Weiqi

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Good question! I've actually been debating that myself. I believe they might be closely tied together, but may actually be separate organizations.
item.content:encoded: Good question! I’ve actually been debating that myself. I believe they might be closely tied together, but may actually be separate organizations.

item.title: By: King Kenny
item.dc:creator: King Kenny
item.description: Hi, I stumbled upon your blog and read through this entry of yours... Was it the HKGA (Hong Kong Go Association) that you visited or the HKCGA (Hong Kong Children's Go Association)? Or are they the same?
item.content:encoded: Hi, I stumbled upon your blog and read through this entry of yours… Was it the HKGA (Hong Kong Go Association) that you visited or the HKCGA (Hong Kong Children’s Go Association)? Or are they the same?

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's amazing!!! I totally should do that! I'm glad that you enjoyed this post though. Hopefully we will get a chance to play one another some day!
item.content:encoded: That’s amazing!!! I totally should do that! I’m glad that you enjoyed this post though. Hopefully we will get a chance to play one another some day!

item.title: By: Jenny Everywhere
item.dc:creator: Jenny Everywhere
item.description: That's a wonderful experience! I have that same magnetic go board. I put it in my purse when I go to a particular buffet restaurant for lunch. I'll eat, then set up the board and replay a pro game or work on life and death problems. A waitress stopped to look, and was very effusive, saying that she used to play with her brother many years ago. It was a real thrill to her to see someone playing. We talked as long as she could spare some time.
item.content:encoded: That’s a wonderful experience! I have that same magnetic go board. I put it in my purse when I go to a particular buffet restaurant for lunch. I’ll eat, then set up the board and replay a pro game or work on life and death problems. A waitress stopped to look, and was very effusive, saying that she used to play with her brother many years ago. It was a real thrill to her to see someone playing. We talked as long as she could spare some time.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thank you! I have also heard that the one with the sketchy entrance has a playing area too, but it seems activities have been moved over to this new area. That's awesome that you got a chance to play some locals! I would have loved to have that experience as well. Haha.
item.content:encoded:
Thank you! I have also heard that the one with the sketchy entrance has a playing area too, but it seems activities have been moved over to this new area.
That’s awesome that you got a chance to play some locals! I would have loved to have that experience as well. Haha.

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description: Nice story! I was actually in HK around New Years and had a similar experience. I found the website and ended up going to that first location (the one on central). I had some reservations about that sketchy entrance, but decided to go in anyway. There actually was a playing area there and a lot of booketc., albeit not as big as that other place you went to (which I didn't know existed lol). I was worried that there would be only old people like in japan, but luckily there were a couple of people a my age and I got two games in. It was a lot of fun! That lesson sure sounds nice though...
item.content:encoded: Nice story! I was actually in HK around New Years and had a similar experience. I found the website and ended up going to that first location (the one on central). I had some reservations about that sketchy entrance, but decided to go in anyway. There actually was a playing area there and a lot of booketc., albeit not as big as that other place you went to (which I didn’t know existed lol). I was worried that there would be only old people like in japan, but luckily there were a couple of people a my age and I got two games in. It was a lot of fun! That lesson sure sounds nice though…

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Glad you enjoyed it! Go is definitely a great way to meet friends. I have definitely been fortunate to meet so many great people like you through go. Thanks for stopping by!
item.content:encoded: Glad you enjoyed it! Go is definitely a great way to meet friends. I have definitely been fortunate to meet so many great people like you through go. Thanks for stopping by!

item.title: By: Devin Flake
item.dc:creator: Devin Flake
item.description: Awesome experience! It reminds me of the go proverb - "use go to meet friends" - http://senseis.xmp.net/?UseGoToMeetFriends For me, go has been a great way to meet new people and have a lot of fun :) Thanks for sharing!
item.content:encoded:
Awesome experience! It reminds me of the go proverb – “use go to meet friends” – http://senseis.xmp.net/?UseGoToMeetFriends
For me, go has been a great way to meet new people and have a lot of fun ðŸ™‚
Thanks for sharing!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You're welcome! I'm glad that you enjoyed it! Yeah I really wish I had the whole kifu, but we just didn't have enough time for me to copy down the moves though. In the future however, I need to make sure I at least take a picture of the final result. That's better than nothing in my opinion.
item.content:encoded:
You’re welcome! I’m glad that you enjoyed it!
Yeah I really wish I had the whole kifu, but we just didn’t have enough time for me to copy down the moves though. In the future however, I need to make sure I at least take a picture of the final result. That’s better than nothing in my opinion.

item.title: By: Eyecatcher
item.dc:creator: Eyecatcher
item.description: Yes, great story, very nice adventure! Thank you again for sharing... ;-)
item.content:encoded:
Yes, great story, very nice adventure! Thank you again for sharing…
